title.narrative: Reorganise from milk collector into a service providing cooperative

description.narrative:
The Tanga Dairies Co-operative Union (TDCU) is the umbrella organization for 15 Primary Co-operative Societies (PCS) with a total membership of more than 4,000 dairy farmers. The cooperative is responsible for the milk collection and payment to the farmers. Milk is delivered to Tanga Fresh. Tanga Fresh is a factory producing pasteurised milk, yoghurt and cheese which is sold in the region.
Although TDCU is an example within Tanzania (the only large milk cooperative) their position is becoming weaker as the focus is only on milk collection while they should focus on providing services to the farmers. As they don't have the knowledge to pick this up, they should be assisted by Agriterra to make this reorganisation possible.
Since 2007, Agriterra regularly supported Tanga Dairies Co-operative Union (TDCU). As part of the policy to support a cooperative with an extensive program to be able to strengthen the organisation, a scoping mission took place in May and a company assessment was done in July 2012. As a result of the company assessment, it was decided to support TDCU, under the condition that some suggestions of Agriterra would be followed up.
The Tanga Dairies Co-operative Union (TDCU) is the umbrella organization for 15 Primary Co-operative Societies (PCS) with a total membership of more than 4,000 dairy farmers. The cooperative is responsible for the milk collection and payment to the farmers. Milk is delivered to Tanga Fresh. Tanga Fresh is a factory producing pasteurised milk, yoghurt and cheese which is sold in the region. Currently about maximum 65 percent of the milk is delivered by TDCU. TDCU currently owns 35 percent of the shares, but has an option to buy more shares the coming years.
The organisation currently stands at an important point in which their future role should be decided on and the way forward. Farmers would like to receive higher income. This could be achieved through more milk, higher milk price and less cost. Higher production could be achieved to having access to services (feed, vaccination, extension services, etc…) and better genetic animals. TDCU could and should play an important role in achieving this for the farmers by providing services to their members. The (future) role of TDCU should become: 1. Input and supply services: o Food for animals o Artificial insemination services o Vaccination program o Loan programs (Sacco, ….) 2. Communication and education (extension services, ….) 3. Supervision of management Tanga Fresh 4. Negotiations on milk price As the board of TDCU agreed with the above, quite a change has to be materialised to make this possible.
In the action plan steps for the coming months are described to start with this reorganisation. Focus areas of the reorganisation are: * Changing the 15 primary cooperatives into one cooperative * Providing knowledge and services * Professionalisation * Becoming a main shareholder of TDCU
Support the milk cooperative in their change into a service oriented cooperative and prepare them for the future developments
